title: Black Screen at Champ Select
body:
Riot,
Getting frustrated by being penalized for quitting a game when the screen goes black after everyone is 'accepts' the match and is transferred to the initial champ select.  Has happened on two separate computers at two separate houses.  Bug

replies.body:
I Tried uninstall / reinstall 3 times 
I changed windows 2 times
I installed all necessary programs
I had only recommended programs and LOL installed.
I have bought this pc especially to work with high resolution high everything
I written a message about this to riot
I have reseted my ip 
I did everything I have found on support page from riot

PS : works if I want to spectate , works playing Dota 2 and other games wich means its not from my internet or from my graphics

it happens 2 days now... 2 days of trying :((

hope someone will find a solution for me {{champion:86}} 



So frustrating{{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}

Its the friends list that is making you lag.
Anything you do on the friends list will make you lag.
Try minimizing your friends list, 
It helps reduce that black screen or get rid of it.
I hope this is the solution, because if riot needs to fix it.

I think i found out that the friend list is too long, 
riot needs to remove the offline friends in a separate minimized list
and keep the ones online open.
I bet that it will reduce the lag time of the black screen and keep the friends list open 
and don't have to minimize it.

Riot Support is giving me the classic runaround of asking whether I've allowed admin privileges, updated directx, etc. ofc, I have (I wouldn't be contacting them if the solution were that simple).

The only solution I haven't tried yet is reinstalling League. Usually when a file becomes corrupt (which is the primary reason reinstalling works), the program will crash, rather than continuing to function properly. I don't imagine reinstalling will help, but I'll do it when I have a couple spare hours.

EDIT: fixed by repairing game files. At the launcher screen, click the '?' near the top right. Then choose repair.

I've had this problem for well over a year now. I couldn't tell you how many times I've re-installed league but it's well over 20. If anyone's curios this problem has been around since 2013/2014 and riot hasn't even acknowledged it. In all honesty it's probably because there aren't many people with the problem so they don't really care enough to address it. I saw someone said to delete your S_OK file and I'm going to follow up if I keep getting it after this. It's located in Riot games > League of Legends > Projects >  lol_air_client > relases > 0.0.1.217 (This will probably be different depending on when you read this because that's the patch I'm on currently). IMPORTANT: It worked but it's basically just another way of re-installing league without re-installing everything. It's just faster way around the problem rather then fully fixing it, however I'm not sure if it won't work cause I just tried it but it's a start I guess. I'm not going to get my hopes up because trust me I've tried everything to fix this problem for well over a year.
